page.title: 04CARNETHY HILL,near PENICUIK
page.content: { } A group from the class climbed {Carnethy Hill}which is almost 2000 feet high.An old path crossed the reservoir at{Loganlea}and this track was followed. There are lots of narrow {sheep trails}and half-way up a rest was taken at an old{sheep pen.}It was an interesting{dry stane dyke}built in a circle. The group observed a {rabbit's}skull, a{hare}and heard the call of a{curlew}and a{cuckoo.}There is a{marker cairn}at the summit and wonderful{views}can be seen of the River Forth and its valley as well as the countryside around Penicuik.
